name: places/ChIJl6g2IgtZwokR-bq28fUpzWA
adrFormatAddress: 365 1st Ave., New York, NY 10010-6503, USA

originalText.text: They have everything and everything is organized and clean! A great local store to support. I’ll be coming here to stock up on school and party supplies; cashier was very friendly too. I even called beforehand to ask if they had what I was looking for and they went above and beyond to help. Great place.

originalText.text: Love this little 99c & Up store. It's always clean and has great merch: from cute $1.99 earrings to lightbulbs, lovely hand gloves and tea light candles. The manager is very nice, too. A convenient, Turtle Bay neighborhood spot to pick up affordable essentials and thoughtful gifts. Manhattan's East Side needs more of these friendly, 'old-school' dollar store locations.

text.text: Love this little 99c & Up store. It's always clean and has great merch: from cute $1.99 earrings to lightbulbs, lovely hand gloves and tea light candles. The manager is very nice, too. originalText.text:
My daughter bought three of these squishy orbs at this store on her lunch break. She gave two to her sisters at school. An hour later when I picked them up from school one of the orbs was leaking. We walked over to the store, a block from their school, to make an exchange or request a refund. The store refused to allow us to exchange the toy and refused to give us a refund.

We have shopped for miscellaneous items in this store since it opened. We have spent hundreds of dollars on different items in this store. It's shocking that they wouldn't refund $1.30 to a child who just bought the toy hours ago. We will choose to take our business elsewhere. Attached are photos of the toy.

originalText.text: This could be a coincidence, but the one and only time I bought stuff there; my credit card was fraudulently used to buy Domino's Pizza in Jersey City that same day. I live in Brooklyn just to be clear. The lady took my card and scanned it; I did not use a machine myself so that raised a flag. I think they have a skimmer so use cash or pass them by. I just wanted to share that and the way I feel, the nasty Domino's Pizza served true justice here; in the hopeful form of violent diarrhea.
